CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 20, 1958, page 2, reads: "Play Despite Poverty - Despite the bad conditions under which they are forced to live, youngsters of the Parrish family have a good time outside their dwelling with the latest fad - hula hoops. Their mother and father are worrying about how they can decently house the youngsters who appear bright and alert."
TitMainTitle: Three Parrish children playing with hula hoops on sidewalk in front of condemed brick house with man and woman in doorway and Goode Real Estate Company for sale sign on Gilmore Way
